content: **ghost worry worm crochet pattern** ----------------------------------------------------- meet hailey the hug-a-boo worm this cute little ghost worry worm is a not-so-spooky companion to keep the kiddos entertained and worry-free this halloween you can use this little ghost worry worm as - gifts for kids - in classrooms as a calming tool - for trick-or-treats or - to hide out & about for people to find video tutorial https //youtu be/qohgjn_l6kg&list=plcn4wqpvdzplul-9sw6uqt9smtk2ozc8- it s an easy and fun project that your children will adore and it s the perfect addition to your halloween decor if you re new to the idea of worry worms you can have a look at this post where i explain why worry worms are so special https //startcrochet com/worry-worms-story-pattern-poems/ 1 if you d like to add some pre-designed tags to your crocheted ghosties you may purchase them from my blog here sold separately they are a pdf printable and you have the option to edit the design or poem with a free canva account https //startcrochet com/product/ghost-worry-worm-poem-tags-pdf-printable/ 2 **new themed worry worms crochet patterns + poem tags bundle sale ** i designed some more themed worry worms that you could use throughout the year for different seasons/occasions have a look at these new worry worm designs as well https //startcrochet com/crochet-worry-worms-bundle-sale/ 3 ghost worry worm video tutorial https //youtu be/qohgjn_l6kg&list=plcn4wqpvdzplul-9sw6uqt9smtk2ozc8- ---------------------------------------- **materials needed** - yarn - simply chunky - paper white i used paintbox yarns simply chunky - paper white 100% acrylic would be great if you have glow-in-the-dark yarn - crochet hook that fits your yarni used a g/6 4 mm hook - a darning needle - a pair of scissors - for the eyes either a strand of black yarn or some stick-on eyes i used 5 mm plastic half round flat back black beads eyes these do not have adhesive on the back so you will need a dab of glue to attach them you can see several options for worry worm eyes here - for the mouth either a strand of black yarn to make a smile or a small piece of black felt cut out into a tiny oval shape glue to attach the eyes and felt mouth **abbreviations** mc = magic_ring chain = chain single_crochet = single_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet slip_stitch = slip_stitch st = stitch sts = stitches fo = fasten_off **skill level** beginner knowledge of how to work a magic_ring or alternative required **gauge** 12 sts & 16 row = 4 10 cm in single_crochet gauge is not really that crucial for this project just try experimenting with different hook sizes & different weight yarns to get a gauge you are happy with for the project you are working on if your ghost worry worm looks narrower than you anticipated try a heavier weight yarn if you want your ghost worry worm to be longer just increase the number of stitches in your body chain **size** this ghost worry worm measures about 4 7 12 cm in height **yardage** weight
